result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emma D. Beighley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11;48 a.m. Defendant Emma D. Beighley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm390 and 16CM370. Voorhees states agreement. State moves to dismiss but read-in 15cm390 for purposes of restitution - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea. Pfeifer/Voorhees/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Restitution - $154.00 includes 10%
Jail credit - 22 days if revoked
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 11:56 a.m. 
  Review hearing scheduled for January 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Emma D. Beighley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:36
Calling 16cm370 and 15cm390 - 
Defendant has waived counsel on 16cm370  - but now will be represented by Voorhees-
Now in receipt of 16cm370 - waive reading - Not guilty plea- 
Bail continued on both cases - 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Emma D. Beighley in court,via video  in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:39
Calling 16cm370 and 15cm390
Defendant again waives counsel - Court statement to bond - Sowinski statement - Defendant statement - her Aunt Robin Mustache can guarantee her getting to court - Court will modify to sig bond - last warning -  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Emma D. Beighley in court, in custody via video.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaing, right to counsel, defendant will proceed own.  Court reads on waiver of counsel - waiver free and voluntary.  Pfeifer to bail cash bond - Court sets $500.00 cash bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Bond done on 16cm case
per Mary @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO
per Mary @ ONSO - detainer - Vilas County

11:47 am. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees has no information for Court as to defendant's non-appearance - State has made proposal that Voorhees believes will resolve matter. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 11:48 a.m.

1:54 p.m. Defendant Emma D. Beighley in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees states very recent proposal made - not resolved yet - but likely to be resolved. Adj. 1:54 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:32 p.m. Defendant Emma D. Beighley in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant contacted PD's office - state she is eligible but does not know who will be representing - John Voorhees now in court - Will represent but has not had chance to talk to client.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Voorhees would like to modify bail but does not have enough information at this time.  Defendant statement to bail - needs to take baby to doctor's appointments - baby needs to have surgery next month. Defendant cannot raise money for cash bail. Voorhees/Michlig statement to bail. Court modifies to $2500 signature bond. No contact with RK. 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

1:19 p.m. Defendant Emma D. Beighley in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel, Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $500 cash bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
